    • Constructor Detail

      • BodyHolder

        public BodyHolder(com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.Body body)
        Initialize a body holder with an existing body
        Parameters:
        body - Body to initialize with

      • BodyHolder

        public BodyHolder(WorldManager world,
                  com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 position,
                  com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 size,
                  com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.BodyDef.BodyType type,
                  float density,
                  boolean sensor,
                  int id)
        Initialize a body holder with body parameters
        Parameters:
        world - world to be created in
        position - relative coordinates for the starting position
        size - size of the body, in width/height format (e.g. [32, 64])
        type - type of body - static, dynamic, or kinematic
        density - density of body to be created
        sensor - whether the body is a sensor - this means it will not be collideable, but can still detect collisions
        id - id of the body holder, determined by the program - this is usually generated

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public void update(float delta,
                   CameraController camera,
                   WorldManager manager)
        Main superclass update method.
        Parameters:
        delta - the program delta time
        camera - camera whose viewport will be used to draw the body
        manager - world the body is in

      • setDrift

        public void setDrift(float drift)
        Set the drift of the body - can be used in vehicle processing
        Parameters:
        drift - a number that should be anywhere from 0 to 10. 10 is almost no friction, and vice versa.

      • getBody

        public com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.Body getBody()
        Get the body
        Returns:
        return the body

      • killDrift

        public void killDrift()
        Kill the current drift by setting the linear velocity of the body to it's forward velocity, cancelling perpendicular
